evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Jamie expressed fear about job interviews and networking, specifically freezing up and worrying about saying something stupid. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: The AI Coach suggested starting small with networking, practicing common interview questions, and conducting mock interviews. Jamie accepted these solutions and practiced drafting responses. 3) Student's response to solutions: Jamie initially hesitated but engaged in text-based practice, refining answers and showing enthusiasm. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: Jamie successfully drafted and improved responses to interview questions, recognized the value of showing enthusiasm, and articulated a weakness positively.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Freezing during job interviews, especially when explaining coding concepts, 2) Panic during presentations leading to leaving a group presentation, 3) General anxiety about job prospects and academic pressure. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) 3-step 'oops plan' for interviews, 2) Safety net script for panic moments, 3) Practicing interview skills with a pet. Student's response to solutions: Positive, expressed relief, and asked for a follow-up session. Evidence of progress/improvement: Willingness to start low-pressure practice, positive reception to strategies, and decreased anxiety level.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Jamie discussed fears about networking, interviews, and virtual participation. Solutions offered included micro-networking (sending one LinkedIn message), normalizing interview failures, and gradually increasing virtual engagement (turning camera on for club meetings). Jamie responded positively, committing to sending a LinkedIn message and considering camera-on participation. Evidence of progress includes Jamie's willingness to take small, actionable steps and expressed relief about interview expectations.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Jamie expressed fear of job interviews and networking, citing concerns about freezing up, saying something stupid, and feeling fake. Solutions offered/accepted: The AI Coach suggested starting small with LinkedIn comments, practicing interview questions using a structured formula, and roleplaying over Zoom. Jamie responded positively, successfully answering "Why computer science?" and agreeing to use personal stories in networking. Evidence of progress/improvement: Jamie smiled and acknowledged the win, showing reduced anxiety and increased confidence in interview preparation.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Jamie's fear of job interviews and networking, tendency to freeze up, and parental tracking. Solutions offered/accepted: Practicing 3-second pauses, using index cards with bullet points, collecting one useful thing per conversation, and finding solidarity in shared experiences. Student's response to solutions: Jamie showed willingness to try the index card trick and practice with their cat, found comfort in shared parental tracking stories, and laughed at the 'taco-lake' anecdote. Evidence of progress/improvement: Jamie articulated fears clearly, accepted concrete solutions, and showed reduced anxiety by the end of the conversation.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Jamie expressed fear of social interactions, particularly in group projects and networking, and anxiety about class participation and presentations. Solutions offered/accepted: The AI Coach suggested practical strategies like gripping a pencil to manage shaky hands, preparing a go-to phrase for when blanking out, and recognizing physical symptoms of anxiety. Student's response to solutions: Jamie showed engagement by scribbling notes, laughing at the suggestion, and planning to try the strategies in class. Evidence of progress/improvement: Jamie's shoulders relaxed slightly, and they expressed willingness to report back, indicating reduced anxiety and increased confidence.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Jamie discussed fears about job interviews, networking, and speaking up in group projects. Solutions offered included practicing low-stakes conversations, preparing one idea for group meetings, and scripting a 15-second self-introduction. Jamie accepted these solutions, recognizing debugging as a leadership skill and agreeing to practice the intro. Evidence of progress included reduced backtracking, visible relaxation, and a willingness to take byte-sized steps toward improvement.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Jamie expressed fear of networking and job interviews, particularly around small talk and follow-up questions. Solutions offered/accepted: Starting with low-pressure online interactions (Discord), preparing one specific question (favorite IDE), and RSVPing to the CS mixer with a plan to stay for 15 minutes. Student's response to solutions: Jamie submitted the RSVP, planned to use a fidget cube and snack table strategy, and prepared a specific question. Evidence of progress/improvement: Jamie showed willingness to attend the mixer, prepared a question, and understood the follow-up technique, indicating reduced anxiety and increased confidence.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Jamie expressed nervousness about job interviews and networking, particularly freezing up and mind going blank. Solutions offered/accepted: The AI Coach suggested practicing elevator pitches, role-playing, carrying a notebook for bullet points, and scripting go-to responses. Jamie accepted these solutions and successfully drafted and delivered a personalized self-introduction. Student's response to solutions: Jamie showed improvement by reducing apologies, embracing authenticity, and handling silence better. Evidence of progress/improvement: Jamie delivered a confident and engaging intro, recognized the brevity of perceived silence, and went 37 seconds without apologizing.
